intro: Persicaria subcoriacea, commonly known as rough knotweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and disturbed areas. Persicaria subcoriacea is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes, making it a common weed in certain environments.
